00016 // INCLUDE FILES
00017 #include <e32std.h>
00018 #include <e32base.h>
00019 #include <txtfrmat.h>
00020 
00021 #include "servertimeouttimer.h"
00022 #include "serverimage.h"
00023 #include "animation.pan"
00024 
00025 // ============================ MEMBER FUNCTIONS ===============================
00026 
00027 // Animation server object class functions.
00028 // These functions are called by the windows server from
00029 // requests made by the client animation dll.
00030 
00031 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00032 // CImage::CImage()
00033 // C++ default constructor can NOT contain any code, that might leave.
00034 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00035 //
00036 CImage::CImage()
00037     {
00038     // No implementation required
00039     }
00040 
00041 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00042 // CImage::ConstructL()
00043 // Symbian 2nd phase constructor can leave.
00044 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00045 //
00046 void CImage::ConstructL( TAny* /* aArgs */, TBool /* aHasFocus */ )
00047     {
00048     // Initialise starting points to the top left hand corner
00049     iLastPoint.SetXY( 0, 0 );
00050     iNewPoint.SetXY( 1, 1 );
00051 
00052     // Set up how far the shape moves each timer event
00053     iDeltaX = KStepSize;
00054     iDeltaY = KStepSize;
00055 
00056     // Animation reset not requested by user
00057     iAnimationReset = EFalse;
00058 
00059     // initiates an initial position update
00060     iDrawn = ETrue;
00061 
00062     // Set the rectangles size
00063     iSize.SetSize( 20,20 );
00064 
00065     // Store the screen size
00066     iScreenSize = iWindowFunctions->WindowSize();
00067 
00068     // Set the screen visible
00069     iWindowFunctions->SetVisible( ETrue );
00070 
00071     // We are using a timer, not the built in synchronising, so turn it off
00072     iFunctions->SetSync( MAnimGeneralFunctions::ESyncNone );
00073 
00074     // Create the timeout timer
00075     iServerTimer = CTimeOutTimer::NewL( EPriorityHigh, *this );
00076 
00077     // Set the timeout period
00078     iServerTimer->After( KTimerPeriod );
00079     }
00080 
00081 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00082 // CImage::~CImage()
00083 // Destructor.
00084 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00085 //
00086 CImage::~CImage()
00087     {
00088     // If the CTimer derived object exists and has an outstanding request,
00089     // cancel it.
00090     if ( iServerTimer )
00091         {
00092         iServerTimer->Cancel();
00093         }
00094 
00095     // Then delete the timer object
00096     delete iServerTimer;
00097     iServerTimer = NULL;
00098     }
00099 
00100 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00101 // CImage::Redraw()
00102 // Redraw the animation server object, includes rubbing out the old object.
00103 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00104 //
00105 void CImage::Redraw()
00106     {
00107     // get the background colour
00108     TLogicalRgb backgroundColour( TLogicalRgb::ESystemBackgroundColor );
00109 
00110     // Clear the old image.
00111     iGc->SetPenSize( TSize( 3,3 ) );
00112     iGc->SetPenColor( backgroundColour );
00113     iGc->DrawRect( TRect( iLastPoint, iSize ) );
00114 
00115     // Draw a shape at the new position
00116     iGc->SetPenSize( TSize( 1,1 ) );
00117     iGc->SetPenColor( KRgbBlack );
00118     iGc->DrawRect( TRect( iNewPoint, iSize ) );
00119 
00120     // signal that the current position has been drawn
00121     iDrawn = ETrue;
00122     }
00123 
00124 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00125 // CImage::FocusChanged()
00126 // Not bothered if the focus has changed.
00127 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00128 //
00129 void CImage::FocusChanged( TBool /* aState */ )
00130     {
00131     }
00132 
00133 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00134 // CImage::Animate()
00135 // Animate the animation server object.
00136 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00137 //
00138 void CImage::Animate( TDateTime* /* aDateTime */ )
00139     {
00140 
00141     // if the last position has been drawn, update the position
00142     if ( iDrawn )
00143         {
00144         // this position has not been drawn, so clear the flag
00145         iDrawn = EFalse;
00146 
00147 
00148         // Save the current position, so we can rub it out later
00149         iLastPoint = iNewPoint;
00150 
00151         // Check current position, 
00152         // reverse the direction if either limit is reached
00153         if ( ( iNewPoint.iX == iScreenSize.iTl.iX ) ||
00154            ( ( iNewPoint.iX + iSize.iWidth ) == iScreenSize.iBr.iX ) )
00155             {
00156             iDeltaX = -iDeltaX;
00157             }
00158 
00159         // Setup the next X coordinate
00160         iNewPoint.iX += iDeltaX;
00161 
00162         // Repeat for y coordinate
00163         if ( ( iNewPoint.iY == iScreenSize.iTl.iY ) ||
00164            ( ( iNewPoint.iY + iSize.iHeight ) == iScreenSize.iBr.iY ) )
00165             {
00166             iDeltaY = -iDeltaY;
00167             }
00168         iNewPoint.iY += iDeltaY;
00169 
00170         // Check for user requested reset
00171         if ( iAnimationReset )
00172             {
00173             iNewPoint.iX = 1;
00174             iNewPoint.iY = 1;
00175             iDeltaX = KStepSize;
00176             iDeltaY = KStepSize;
00177             iAnimationReset = EFalse;
00178             }
00179 
00180 
00181         // Alternative method, works well on the MARM target, jumps on the
00182         // windows emulator, simply uncomment and recompile
00183         //iFunctions->ActivateGc();
00184         //Redraw();
00185 
00186         // Force a draw to be performed by declaring the screen invalid
00187         iWindowFunctions->Invalidate( iScreenSize );
00188         }
00189     }
00190 
00191 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00192 // CImage::CommandReplyL()
00193 // Function to be used for nonbuffered commands. Not used in this example.
00194 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00195 //
00196 TInt CImage::CommandReplyL( TInt aOpcode, TAny* /* aArgs */ )
00197     {
00198     return aOpcode;
00199     }
00200 
00201 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00202 // CImage::Command()
00203 // Function for buffered commands and commands that cannot fail/leave.
00204 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00205 //
00206 void CImage::Command( TInt aOpcode, TAny* /* aArgs */ )
00207     {
00208     switch ( aOpcode )
00209         {
00210     case KAnimationReset:
00211         // Set a flag to reset the animation back to the top left
00212         iAnimationReset = ETrue;
00213         break;
00214         
00215     case KResolutionChange:
00216         iAnimationReset = ETrue;
00217         iScreenSize = iWindowFunctions->WindowSize();
00218         break;
00219 
00220     default:
00221         User::Panic( KAnimation, EPanicAnimationServer );
00222         break;
00223         }
00224     }
00225 
00226 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00227 // CImage::TimedOut()
00228 // Timer control, called everytime the time times out.
00229 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00230 //
00231 void CImage::TimedOut()
00232     {
00233     // Reset the timer timeout period
00234     iServerTimer->After( KTimerPeriod );
00235 
00236     // Call the animation function for this image
00237     iFunctions->Animate( 0 );
00238     }
00239 
00240 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00241 // CImage::OfferRawEvent()
00242 // For handling raw events. Not used in this example.
00243 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00244 //
00245 TBool CImage::OfferRawEvent( const TRawEvent& /*aRawEvent*/ )
00246     {
00247     return ETrue;
00248     }
